ygData.subject: Re: Very slow after DirectX 9 patch
ygData.msgSnippet: It seems crazy to me that Sony should be willing to sacrifice many of their loyal users for the sake of a minor upgrade, especially when everything worked well
ygData.messageBody:
It seems crazy to me that Sony should be willing to sacrifice many of
their loyal users for the sake of a minor upgrade, especially when
everything worked well before.

Our PC is about 5 years old, it is a PII 450, but which was very
recently upgraded to a new NVidia GEForce, the max 384Mb RAM and a
60GB hard disk, all of which was done at the time for EQ.

I am sure they will have to do something about this, if this group is
anything to go by, there wiill be tens of thousands of people affeted
by this "upgrade".

Regards.


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "flaumigevylke"
<flaumigevylke@w...> wrote:
> Today I had to download 4 different drivers for my graphics card
before
> they were happy with my configuration and would let me play on my
main
> computer. My laptop, less then one year old, is still unable to get
on as
> the card is no longer supported. When I finally did get through to
tech
> support I was told by one of their "experienced tech support
personnel "
> that my backup computer is a dinosaur and unable to use their game
any more.
> . it's 2 years old but the graphics card is what's holding it up.
>
> Hmm choices, decisions, should I use my back up computer with the
slow
> processor to run my business, my laptop which my husband uses in
his semi
> truck so it's usually at the other side of the country, my business
computer
> to play around on and hope the IRS don't find out about the
deduction I've
> claimed, or should I just tell EQ what I think of them and cancel
all our
> accounts? Bah going to kill skellies while I think about this, not
a happy
> beasty right now
>
> Flaumigavylke
> Quellious
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: apcooper
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Tuesday, March 23, 2004 5:58 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Very slow after DirectX 9 patch
>
>
> Hello,
>
> We have DirectX 9 with all the latest graphics card drivers. Today
> Everquest auto downloaded the DX9 patch, and that has slowed EQ
down
> to the point where it is virtually unusable.
>
> Has anyone else seen this, and is there anything that can be done
> about it?
>
> Thank you very much.
